answers.answer: Crid - there are a lot of symptoms in your post!First,  if you're drinking commercial cranberry juice (at about $3 a quart) you're not getting cranberry.  You're getting sugar,  and it won't help keep you from getting a bladder infection.  It tastes like cranberry,  that's about it.  Real cranberry juice costs about $17 a quart,  and you can only get it at specialty grocery stores.Second,  if you're not eating much,  that would cause your shaky dizzy feelings.  Sounds like low blood sugar.I don't know why you aren't able to eat.     ???Best wishes.

"For the past week in a half, a lot of the time I feel like I have to use the bathroom, but when I go, nothing. It happens a lot, and it has gotten me so confused of whether I have to use the bathroom or not."Sounds like a UTI.  With onset diabetes, one usually urinates excessively as opposed to the "feeling" of needing to continously go."And I know this sounds like a lot but also for some reason(not sure why) my heart starts racing, beating really hard, I get shaky, dizzy, lightheaded, that deal, and I'm not sure what's causing that either."You are describing classic symptoms of a panic attack (that doesnt mean this is what it is though).  Another thing that comes to mind is you may have either low blood sugar or a sugar "rush".  As the previous poster mentioned, if you are drinking the cheap cranberry juice you are really just drinking cranberry flavored "sugar" water.  If you are sensitive to changes in sugar levels, the drink could cause your problems - do you notice your symptoms after eating or drinking anything (or from NOT doing so?).  Also, cranberry does not prevent you from getting a UTI, it just reduces your chances (likewise, getting a flu shot does not guarentee you will not get the flu).Please see your doctor.
